Insurance & Premium
Self-Pay Options for
Physical Therapy

Whether you're using insurance or paying out-of-pocket, I provide personalized care with advanced technology to help you move and feel better. My one-person practice offers both insurance-covered treatment and premium self-pay options to meet your specific needs.

Major Plans Accepted

I currently accept most commercial insurance plans such as:
Aetna, UnitedHealthcare (UHC), and Blue Cross Blue Shield (BCBS).

If you have a Medicaid or Medicare managed plan like HealthFirst, WellCare, or VillageCare, please check your insurance coverage here. I'll personally review and let you know if I can accept your plan.

Understanding Your Costs

Some plans have deductibles, copays, or out-of-pocket limits. I'll explain what to expect so there are no surprises.

Self-Pay Options & First Visit Information

Service Price Description
Radical Shockwave + Laser $60 For soft tissue recovery and pain relief
Focused Shockwave $140 Deep tissue precision for chronic issues
PT Evaluation $120 Includes AI screening + treatment suggestions
Follow-Up PT (60 mins) $100 Manual therapy, movement training, and tech support
AI Movement Assessment $100 Standalone 10-movement AI screening with instant corrective exercise suggestions; no PT session required.

üí¨ Life can be hard. If you're facing financial stress, please feel free to bring it up on your first visit. We'll figure something out together‚Äîyour healing journey matters most.

Special for First-Time Insurance Patients

You can try advanced upgrades: Radical Shockwave + Class 4 Laser for just $30 or Focused Shockwave for $60. For your first visit, bring your insurance card, photo ID, and referral (if required).
Tip: As a one-person clinic, I recommend texting or emailing for fastest response within 3 business day.
